title: How did the SDGs come to be? Why were those 17 goals chosen? - Quora

response.answer_text: The process of creation of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) was, according to this article from The Guardian[1], way more thorough and inclusive than the one which saw the creation of the Millennium Development Goals that the SDGs eventually substituted. As the article mentions, the inception of the goals started after the Rio+20 summit in 2012, with the election of a working group representing 70 countries responsible for drafting an agenda. I do not know which the specific countries were included in the working group and whether the representation by a certain country in the working group was spontaneous or not. The UN General Assembly assessed the final draft of the 2030 Agenda (based on the SDGs) from the working group in 2014. Negotiations among the member states followed, until the full formulation of the SDGs and related targets, and final proclamation in the United Nations Sustainable Development Summit 2015 in NYC[2]with 193 signatory countries[3] . I could not find out what specific methods were adopted to manage the negotiation and abstract the wording from each state representative, so that words were systematically condensed into the final formulation of the goals. A distinctive aspect of the creation process of the SDGs was that it was a unique act of wish for a global governance, because of the following characteristics: “inclusive goal-setting process, the non-binding nature of the goals, the reliance on weak institutional arrangements, and the extensive leeway that states enjoy” [4] Footnotes[1] Sustainable development goals: all you need to know[2] United Nations Sustainable Development Summit 2015 .:.
